name: Plaka Hotel

reviews.title: Views of the acropolis from the roof top bar
reviews.text: The best part of this hotel was hands down the view of the Acropolis from the roof top bar. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly, the location was brilliant but it was the roof top bar and views that set it apart.

reviews.title: Awesome view & Good location
reviews.text: We stayed at Plaka Hotel for two nights. We arrived late the first night, we walked from Syntagma Square station (long metro ride from Airport). We were told by the hotel staff that around the corner from the hotel there is a nice strip of alfresco dining opened quite late. We had dinner here at midnight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an Acropolis view room on the top floor. The view from the room was amazing and exactly like the photos! The hotel room was quite large, but with a small bathroom. The rooms are modern and have everything you require for a short stay. A nice view from the rooftop bar, but just the same from our room. The breakfast was quite nice, plenty of variety and they had a good coffee machine.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, unbeatable view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was only a short walk to the Acropolis and New Acropolis Museum. This was the purpose for our visit to Athens. The Acropolis only accepts cash for entry (we learnt this after a long line up and with no cash on hand). Best to go late afternoon to avoid the crowds and heat in Athens.
reviews.title: Good value in a great location

reviews.text: Hotel elevator was very small and extremely slow.
reviews.title: Really great hotel, but had problems sleeping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room at this hotel was very clean and modern although very small. The location of the hotel is really great for tourists who want to be within walking distance of the historical attractions in Athens. The rooftop is a great place to take in the view of the acropolis at night. Breakfast at the hotel was pretty standard (eggs, bacon, pastries, juice, coffee, etc.) and enjoyable. But, the lack of free wifi was disappointing.
reviews.title: Small but servicable room

reviews.text: My friend and I flew in from Los Angeles and got into Greece at about 1am. It was very late by the time we checked in, but the man at the front desk was there waiting for us with a great attitude! What a welcome to Athens! Our room wasn't the nicest I've ever stayed in, but it did the job. The hotel's best quality is the AMAZING view of the acropolis from the roof! The free breakfast in the morning was a plus too! Overall I would recommend this moderately priced hotel to anyone traveling to Athens!
reviews.title: Great customer service, Amazing View

reviews.text: Perfect location in the heart of the plaka, only 15 minute walk to the Acropolis and in the middle of all the shops and restaurants. The roof top view is not to be missed! We had a view of the Acropolis form our room as well - breathtaking... The staff - both day and evening shift - were very courteous and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The comp breakfast was outstanding! Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great view, fabulous staff, perfect location

reviews.text: For 2 nights I stayed in this hotel. The hotel is a bit overpriced for it's location. The very bad part of the hotel is NO free Wifi and a very small lift. You have to wait 10 minutes to get the lift. The reception staffs are not really willing to help you. They are cold blooded.
reviews.title: Overpriced hotel, Nice location: Recommended only for the location

reviews.text: Location wise I would recommend this hotel other wise there is nothing special to mention about this hotel. If you find any other hotel in Plaka area, you can easily opt for that if you want to stay close to Acropolis. For the second time I wouldn't stay here but for the first time it was Ok. I would recommend this hotel only if you want to stay in a nice location.
reviews.title: Plaka Hotel July 2012

reviews.text: Stayed at the Plaka for two nights & were 100% satisfied. It is an easy (3 short blocks) walk from the Monastiraki metro stop, the rooftop terrace & our room had great view of the city & Acropolis. Also you are right at the border between Plaka & Monastiraki neighborhoods & can walk to most major tourist attractions. Room was decent size & very clean and fresh. Bathroom was tiny but typical of others we saw in Greece. Breakfast was generous and tasted fine! Front desk staff is multi-lingual. We paid E145 per night which I felt was a good value for the location & quality. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A winner!
Loved Hotel Plaka
reviews.text: Regarding previous reviewers' comments about noise...I live in downtown Washington DC so didn't notice a thing! Really, if you are used to typical city living you will not be bothered.
Just came back from spending 10 days in Athens, Greece -5/06
reviews.title: Great location, good service, a bit noisy

reviews.text: Stayed at the Plaka Hotel in Athens, Greece.
reviews.title: Watch out

reviews.text: Myself, husband and 11 year old daughter stayed here for one night ( 15th Aug 2012) at the beginning of our mini Greek tour. I had spoken via email with the hotel before arrival and found the staff very helpful providing information on getting from the airport to hotel and also from the hotel to the port of Piraeus.We arrived at about 6pm , room clean and comfortable , a little compact but I think that was because we had the extra bed in the room for our daughter. A small bottle of wine to greet us , which was a nice touch. The rooftop view of the Parthenon is wonderful and we sat up there and had a few drinks, the receptionist then pointed us in the direction of a nearby restaurant which was reasonbly priced and good food. Aircon in the room was good , as was the shower plenty of hot water , we got up early for breakfast which was ok , we were a little disappointed the roof was not open at this early hour. We left our luggage securely in a room off the reception area and were also given a safety deposit box for our passports etc and then the recptionist showed us the best route to the Acropolis. Good hotel , good location and a bargain for £70.
reviews.title: central hotel, fab view
"Small but great customer service and an amazing view"
reviews.text: We stayed here for the first couple of days on a trip. The hotel is a little hard to find but in an excellent part of town. Very easy to get everywhere from there. What made our stay, apart from the view at the top of the building of the Acropolis, was the staff. They treated us like family. They knew our names, asked how our day was when we came in, and gave great recommendations for places to go and eat. There was even fresh fruit, water, and wine in the room when we checked in. They also offer a nice breakfast. I would stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a good find. Well located, well priced and a good rooftop bar (like many other hotels in the area), good size rooms, clean and an ok breakfast. Staff could have been a bit friendlier at the front desk but the hotel manager was fantastic, offerisugaring seeing suggestions to every table at breakfast. I would recommend.
reviews.title: Good well priced hotel
Staff not great but very good value and location
reviews.text: We stayed here on the first leg of our honeymoon. We were not thrilled with the hotel in general, but the price is excellent (100 euros/night in high season) and the location is perfect - in the Plaka neighborhood, the best part of Athens, right near the Acropolis and lots of tavernas. There is a roof deck with a fabulous Acropolis view and lots of chairs and loveseats. We enjoyed the view, but did not spend much time up there because there were always a lot of people smoking. We also had a room with a nice Acropolis view out the window, but no balcony or anything. I don't think I paid more for a view, so it may have been a free upgrade. The breakfast was adequate but nothing extraordinary. There were the standard continental pastries as well as some Greek food, but nothing American like scrambled eggs. I stuck to the croissants, which were decent. My husband had a hard boiled egg that he swears was rotten (he spit it out and didn't get sick or anything). The rooms, other than the view, were pretty hostel-like. Ours was clean but very small and had two twin beds. The hotel gives you an hour if free wifi to use during your stay, but thereafter it is 2 euros for an hour or 8 euros for a day. Not unreasonable but not a great deal. My biggest complaint is with the staff, who were really kind of surly. They gave us recommendations and directions when we asked, but always seemed kind of cold and it was impossible to get a smile out of them. I expected the staff to be a bit more friendly and welcoming. They also did not do anything to recognize our honeymoon. Nonetheless, I would still recommend ths hotel to those looking for a clean, safe, well-located hotel in Athens at a good price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel. The front desk staff were welcoming and helpful when questions about the immediate area, Athens and Greece were asked. Our room was standard with comfortable beds, great air conditioners and an in room fridge. The bathroom was large with warm water for showers. Free wifi for the first hour and 2 euro for each hour following. Despite the busy location of the hotel, the room and hotel were quite. The location was absolutely fantastic and the rooftop view of the Acropolis was amazing. The continental breakfast was the best we had throughout our 3 week Greece vacation and included fresh pastries, cereals, Greek yogurt, hot items, breads (and a toaster), and fresh fruit. The coffee machine had specialty coffee options.Overall a great hotel, close to restaurants, shops and tourist attractions.
reviews.title: Awesome location, staff, room...
Great Location
reviews.text: I would give this hotel 3.5 stars - the location was fabulous, right in the heart of the Plaka. It has been renovated and is very clean, safe and presentable. The bathrooms were very very small but charming nevertheless.

reviews.title: Great place to stay!!!
reviews.text: Great views of the Acropolis from the rooftop - although the drinks were a little overpriced.
Friendly hotel staff. Very Hard Bed.
reviews.title: Terrible Hotel
The Plaka was great
reviews.text: Stay here if you want to be in the heart of the Plaka but not if you are looking for 5 star luxury.

reviews.title: Good hotel for budget travelers.
reviews.text: We loved, loved, loved this hotel! It is about a 20 minute walk to the Acropolis...but the best part is the rooftop bar. It has fabulous views of the ruins all lit up at night. We were in Europe for several weeks, and one of my favorite nights was spent hanging out at the rooftop bar relaxing and admiring the view. It is close to a subway station and a bus station, too, so it is easy to access the rest of Athens. The rooms were very nice and modern. They were pretty roomy too. Your view probably depends on where your room is, and ours looked over a city street, but it was nice. The area it's in is fun, too. There were alot of touristy shops and restaurants, but the owners were able to reccomend some more authentic tavernas to go to that were close by. The staff was friendly and efficient. And it's really reasonably priced (we were there in June 2006, so Greece's high tourist season had not kicked in yet...the prices may be higher in July or August). I would reccomend this hotel to anyone going to Athens!

Kind of torn in regards Hotel Plaka. The location is amazing. Really, can't do any better than this. Great roof top view of the Parthenon. Right by lovely square where you can relax and have a drink in the evening. Moments walk from the Parthenon. Decor is fine and despite other reviewers' complaints I found the bathroom size adequate and fine. But the beds! Oh my word, the beds. Seriously, prison issue. I'm not a fussy sleeper or particularly given to physical ailments but I actually had a back ache after sleeping two nights in a row on these slabs of concrete. Truly bad. I think the noise level depends on what room you are assigned. The noise level in our room was very, very high. Luckily, neither my traveling companion nor I care that much (apartment livers all our lives, so can tune it out). But for those who are sensitive to street noise, best to ask for a room off street. Breakfast was awesome - wonderful spread. We looked forward to it every day. I would have given this a much better star rating if it weren't for those awful, awful beds. Interestingly, all the other positives are strong enough that I would consider staying here for a day or two again (not long term though).
reviews.title: Pros and Cons
Great Location, would not stay long term!
reviews.text: Close to the Plaka Market and the Acropolis. Reasonably priced with friendly staff. However, the beds and pillows are crap. Also, the bathrooms are small but are clean..which is more important to me then size! I'd stay here again for a night but long term. Its not a luxury hotel more like a Holiday Inn.

reviews.title: Horrid nights's sleep
reviews.text: We stayed at the Plaka Hotel in May 2006. Fortunately it was only one night. I don't think I've ever heard so much noise whilst staying at any hotel throughout the world! I thought it worth mentioning the terrible noise coming from the street and how it was impossible to get any sleep except between 2am-4pm. I would certainly think twice before staying here if you value peace and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location:
reviews.title: Fabulous Location

reviews.text: In the heart of Athens. Tons of great shops, restaurants around the hotel. Train stop about 8-10 minutes away, same distance for a bus. I absolutely can not tell you how great a location this hotel has.
reviews.title: Comfortable. Great location. Rooftop bar A+++++!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location in Athens. Walking distance to the Acropolis (thought it's not right around the corner). The best part of this hotel really is the amazing view of the Acropolis from the rooftop bar & restaurant. The room was perfectly satisfactory and clean.
reviews.title: Great value with amazing Acropolis view from the rooftop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best breakfast we have ever had in a Greek hotel and believe me we have eaten in many. It had everything you could wish for. You could even just about construct your own Greek (Horiatiki) salad topped with olive oil, vinegar, oregano,olives and feta cheese!! Now i found our room to be really nice and alot better than i expected as i have stayed in the Plaka a few times before.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Perfect Location

reviews.text: Nice comfortable rooms with a huge shower. Icy cold water, wine and fruit upon arrival. A magnificent view of the Acropolis out your window. Had to pinch ourselves as how many hotels can boast a view like that! The crowning jewel is by far the rooftop bar at night. Couches perfectly positioned to take in the illuminated Parthenon in 2.500 years of celebrated glory!! all the while sipping on a cocktail or your beverage of choice!!
reviews.title: Nice view of the Acropolis from the rooftop and that's all really....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would highly recommend this hotel if you find yourself in the Plaka!
reviews.title: Plaka Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in July with a group of 6.The hotel was clean and centrally located, the rooms were small and breakfast was good. We all thought it was overpriced and to be honest you can get equall or better accomodation elsewhere.
reviews.title: It was very nice stay with excelent view!

description: Most central hotel situated in Plaka district. Strategically located for visiting all main archaeological interests especially the Acropolis and new museum, as well Ancient Agora, Parliament,First Olympic stadium, Benaki museum, Cycladic museum, National Galery. Two blocks away from metro station Monastiraki, with direct line from the airport and the port of Piraeus. 50m from the main shopping street of Ermou and Plaka touristic shops and tavernas.Splendid view of the Acropolis from roof terrace not to be missed.
